meanings.definition: The quality or state of being sketchy or unreliable.
meanings.sent1: The sketchinesses of the old bridge made people nervous to cross it.
meanings.sent2: I could sense some sketchinesses in his story, so I didn't fully believe him.
meanings.sent3: The detective couldn't help but chuckle at the sketchinesses of the suspect's alibi.
meanings.sent4: The sketchinesses of the situation painted a dark cloud over the otherwise cheerful day.
meanings.sent5: The sketchinesses of the stranger's behavior left a lasting impression on me.

meanings.definition: Suspicious or questionable behavior or appearance.
meanings.sent1: The sketchinesses of the man loitering outside the store caught the attention of the security guard.
meanings.sent2: She decided to avoid the alley due to its sketchinesses late at night.
meanings.sent3: The sketchinesses of the cat sneaking around the house made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The sketchinesses of the situation were like a warning sign flashing in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The sketchinesses of the email made her delete it without opening.
